Enabled: Enable logging. Regardless of the value set here
column3: the log of Automatics initialization process will always be output.

Enabled: Specifies the level at which logging is allowed.
Enable the function to open and close the door automatically.
Specify which doors are allowed to open and close automatically.
Specify the display or internal name of any door that is allowed to open and close automatically. A display name is a name displayed in the game
column4: and the specified value will enable the automatic door if it partially matches the target display name. The internal name is the name used on the program side
column6: and the specified value must exactly match the target's internal name for the automatic door to be enabled.

Enabled: the interval at which to call the process to determine whether to open the door. (Unit: second)
the interval at which to call the process to determine whether to close the door. (Unit: second)
The door automatically open when the player is inside the specified radius
column3: with the door as the origin. (Unit: meter)

Enabled: The door automatically close when the player is inside the specified radius
column3: with the door as the origin. (Unit: meter)

Enabled: Shortcut key to enable/disable the automatic door.
Enables automatic pinning to the map.
Specify the range of dynamic objects to be explored. "Dynamic Object" are objects that change position
column5: etc. Set to 0 to disable pinning of dynamic objects. (Unit: meter)

Enabled: Specify the range of static objects to be explored. "Static Object" are objects that do not change their position
column5: etc. Setting this to 0 disables pinning of static objects. (Unit: meter)

Enabled: Specify the range of location to be explored. "Location" is a specific place
column5: etc. Setting this to 0 disables location pinning. (Unit: meter)

Enabled: Exclude tamed animals from automatic pinning.
Specify the interval at which static object search. Setting to 0 disables periodic static object search. (Unit: second)

column3: it recursively searches for the same flora that exist within a specified range and merge them into a single pin. (Unit: meter)

Enabled: Specify whether need to equip a Wishbone to pinning a vein that in ground.

column3: so that it is performed only once each time the shortcut key is pressed.

Enabled: Enable automatic functions for tasks such as cooking
Specify the automatic processing to be allowed for $1
Specify the maximum distance which $1 will search for containers. (Unit: meter)
Count Of Materials To Suppress Automatic Processing For $1

Suppresses automatic processing of $1 to prevent the count of materials stored in a container from falling below a specified quantity. Set to 0 to disable automatic processing suppression based on the count of materials.
Count Of Fuels To Suppress Automatic Processing For $1

Suppresses automatic processing of $1 to prevent the count of fuels stored in a container from falling below a specified quantity. Set to 0 to disable automatic processing suppression based on the count of fuels.
Count Of Products To Suppress Automatic Processing For $1

Suppresses automatic processing of $1 to prevent the count of products stored in a container from exceeding a specified quantity. Set to 0 to disable automatic processing suppression based on the count of products.
Specify the maximum distance which animal will search for food. 0 disables the feed box search and -1 uses the default value for each animal. (Unit: meter)
Need Close To Eat The Feed
Specify whether or not the animal needs to approach the food in order to eat it.
Specify the types of animals allowed to feed from the container.
Enable automatic repair of items and pieces.
Specify the range to search for a crafting station to be used to repair items. Setting to 0 disables periodic item repair. (Unit: meters)
Repair Items When Accessing The Crafting Station
Specify whether or not to repair all items that can be repaired when the workbench GUI is opened.
Specify where the message is displayed when an item is repaired.
Specify the range to search for a pieces to repair. Setting to 0 disables periodic pieces repairs. (Unit: meters)
Specify where the message is displayed when a piece is repaired.
$1 The command "automatics $2" can be used to confirm usage.
Displays the usage of commands added by Automatics.

Usage: automatics [COMMAND]
Displays the usage of commands added by Automatics.

COMMAND: Command name to display usage. If there is an exact match
column4: it will display the first partially matched command found. If omitted
column5: the usage of the automatics command itself is displayed.

Usage: printnames (WORD|REGEXP)
Outputs internal or display names that contain the specified string or match the specified regular expression.

WORD: A text contained in the internal or display name. (e.g. $enemy_
column7: Wood door); All partially matching internal and display names are output.\nREGEXP: A regular expression of the internal or display name to be output. Must be prefixed with "r/". (e.g. r/^[$]item_
